GisIoStream Class Reference

#include <Stream.h>

Inherits GisDisposable.

Inherited by GisIoFileStream, and GisIoMemoryStream.

Inheritance diagram for GisIoStream:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

GisIoStream defines the interface for all Gis streams. Streamed I/O support for various locations, such as files, memory, etc. can be provided by classes that implement this interface.

Note:
There is no function provided to close a GisIoStream. The only way to close it is to destroy it by releasing all references.

Definition at line 31 of file Stream.h.


Public Member Functions

virtual GIS_API GisBoolean CanRead ()
 gets the reading capability.
virtual GIS_API GisBoolean CanWrite ()
 gets the writing capability.
virtual GIS_API GisInt64 GetIndex ()=0
 gets the current position for the stream.
virtual GIS_API GisInt64 GetLength ()=0
 gets the current length of the stream.
virtual GIS_API GisBoolean HasContext ()
 returns whether the stream has any positional context. Streams without context can only be read and written in a forward-only manner. These streams do not allow position and length changes.
virtual GIS_API GisSize Read (GisByte *buffer, GisSize count)=0
 reads the number of bytes indicated by count into the given buffer, or the number of bytes after the current stream position, whichever is less. The stream’s current position is moved ahead by the number of bytes read.
virtual GIS_API void Reset ()=0
 sets the position to the start of the stream.
virtual GIS_API void SetLength (GisInt64)=0
 truncates the stream to the indicated length.
virtual GIS_API void Skip (GisInt64 offset)=0
 skips over part of the stream.
virtual GIS_API void Write (GisIoStream *stream, GisSize count=0)=0
 reads the number of bytes from the given stream, and writes them to this stream.
virtual GIS_API void Write (GisByte *buffer, GisSize count)=0
 writes the number of bytes indicated by count, from the given buffer, to the stream. The current position is moved ahead by the number of bytes written.
